prompt:
Nurse: That sounds like a great idea. Having familiar comforts can make a big difference during your stay. What kind of things are you packing?

Patient: I've got a

Nurse: I'm sorry, Simone, your voice cut out a bit there. Could you please repeat what you were saying?

Patient: some

Nurse: I'm sorry, Simone, your voice cut out a bit there. Could you please repeat what you were saying?

Patient: like, a scented candle. I'm not gonna like the candle, of course, but it has a nice aroma

Nurse: That sounds lovely, scents can indeed bring a lot of comfort. What scent did you choose?

Patient: My in my phone that I'm going to play.

responses.gpt4: It sounds like you're well-prepared with comforting items. Music can be quite therapeutic. Do you have a specific playlist that you enjoy listening to?
responses.our_model: That sounds lovely. Scent can indeed have a powerful effect on our mood. And having your phone with you will certainly keep you connected and entertained. It's clear you're preparing well. You must be looking forward to getting a new knee. Do you have any plans for what you'd like to do once you've recovered from your surgery?
